DataElement.preferredName: Image mAs 8 Byte MM per Second Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The exposure expressed in milliampere seconds (mAs), for example calculated from exposure time and X-Ray tube current.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._A measure of the electric charge and the time in which the charge is dispersed; it is used as a setting on a radiography machine to determine the density of the radiographic image.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the electric charge and the time in which the charge is dispersed; it is used as a setting on a radiography machine to determine the density of the radiographic image.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the electric charge and the time in which the charge is dispersed. This is used as a setting on a radiography machine to determine the density of the radiographic image.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/5/17 jk added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task. 6/20/17 jk Context changed and released as part of Round 5 finalization task. 2/21/12 Curated for imaging studies.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: FD MMperSEC: A floating 8 decimal number that denotes a duration of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.:A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.:A unit of measure equaling one thousandth of a meter. (NCI):The second is the unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour. Abbreviation Sec. is acceptable in non-scientific usage only.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 7 and less than 9 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of seven and one.
A sequence of 8 bits processed as a single unit of information.
A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

A unit of time, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). The second is the duration of 919 263 177 0 periods of the specified light radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the caesium 133 atom in its ground state at 0 K. According to the convention, 60 seconds constitute one minute; 3,600 seconds constitute one hour.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
